sim/operation/g430/
children.description: These datarefs only apply to real, physical G430s, e.g. if you buy an expensive G430 and plug it into your PC!  This is not for any _simulated_ system.
If true, vertical guidance is a glide slope - otherwise it is a GPS vertical guidance indicator.  Comes from the physical units!
children.name: sim/operation/g430/G430_is_vloc

children.description: Enable logging of network data
children.name: sim/operation/misc/debug_network

children.description: The frame rate period. Use the reciprocal to get the frame rate (e.g. 1/mnw.prd).  Writable via override_timestep in 11.10
children.name: sim/operation/misc/frame_rate_period

children.description: How close XP time matches real time. Ideal ratio is 1.  NOTE: in 930 and later time ratio is always 1.0.
children.name: sim/operation/misc/time_ratio

children.description: A consecutively packed series of null terminated C strings - read array size to find total length of all of them.  Contains each separated command line argument
children.name: sim/operation/misc/commandline

children.description: Override control of the joystick deflections (overrides stick, yoke, pedals, keys, mouse, and auto-coordination)
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_joystick

children.description: Override control of the artificial stability system
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_artstab

children.description: Override all parts of the flight system at once
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_flightcontrol

children.description: Override gear and brake status
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_gearbrake

children.description: Override position updates of this plane
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_planepath

children.description: Override the AI's control of the plane via the autopilot
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_plane_ai_autopilot

children.description: Override navcom radios
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_navneedles

children.description: Override nav1 receiver
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_nav1_needles

children.description: Override nav2 receiver
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_nav2_needles

children.description: Override ADF radios
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_adf

children.description: Override DME distances
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_dme

children.description: Override GPS computer
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_gps

children.description: Override raw heading flown by nav (for GPS that fly by roll commands)
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_nav_heading

children.description: Override flight director needles (both axes)
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_flightdir

children.description: Override flight director needles (pitch only)
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_flightdir_ptch

children.description: Override flight director needles (roll only)
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_flightdir_roll

children.description: Override camera control.  NOTE: DO NOT USE, USE XPLMCAMERA!!
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_camera

children.description: Override annunciators
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_annunciators

children.description: Override the autopilot's brains
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_autopilot

children.description: Override the autopilot's ESP/USP function.
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_esp

children.description: Override partial control of a PFC jet cockpit (not for the faint at heart!)
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_pfc_autopilot_lites

children.description: Override just heading (yaw) control (disables auto-coordination). Use yoke_heading_ratio.
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_joystick_heading

children.description: Override just pitch control. Use yoke_pitch_ratio.
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_joystick_pitch

children.description: Override just roll control. Use yoke_roll_ratio.
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_joystick_roll

children.description: Override just heading (yaw) control for copilot input (disables auto-coordination). Use yoke_heading_ratio_copilot.
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_joystick_heading_copilot

children.description: Override just pitch control for copilot input. Use yoke_pitch_ratio_copilot.
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_joystick_pitch_copilot

children.description: Override just roll control for copilot input. Use yoke_roll_ratio_copilot.
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_joystick_roll_copilot

children.description: Override the throttles. Use ENGN_thro_use to control them.
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_throttles

children.description: Override FADEC temperature calculations. Setting this override allows you to write to ENGN_fadec_targets.
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_FADEC

children.description: Override the prop pitch.  Use POINT_pitch_deg_use to edit.
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_prop_pitch

children.description: Override the prop mode.  Use ENGN_propmode to edit.
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_prop_mode

children.description: Override the mixture controls.  Use ENGN_mixt to edit.
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_mixture

children.description: Override ground interactions (see sim/flightmodel/ground) - in v11 this was gone until 11.30.
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_groundplane

children.description: Disable drawing of 3-d cockpit object
children.name: sim/operation/override/disable_cockpit_object

children.description: Disable drawing of 3-d cockpit object
children.name: sim/operation/override/disable_twosided_fuselage

children.description: Override the FMS going to the next waypoint.
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_fms_advance

children.description: Overrides fuel flow variable sim/flightmodel/engine/ENGN_FF_
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_fuel_flow

children.description: Overrides engine temp vars sim/flightmodel/engine/ENGN_EGT_c and ENGN_ITT_c
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_itt_egt

children.description: Overrides engine temp vars sim/flightmodel/engine/ENGN_CHT_c and ENGN_oilT_c
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_cht_oilt

children.description: Overrides indicated airspeed dataref, so it is no longer update 1:1 from calibrated airspeed. Plugin can introduce installation error to indicated airspeed
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_ias

children.description: Overrides groundspeed indication on GPS - groundspeed by default is a 2D speed, the pythag of movement in East and South axis. If you want something else, turn on this override and write to the indicator.
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_gs

children.description: Overrides individual control surfaces, e.g. sim/flightmodel/controls/lail1def
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_control_surfaces

children.description: Overrides all engine calculations - write to LMN and g_nrml/side/axil.
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_engines

children.description: Overrides all engine calculations but not the prop - write the torque your motor generates while the prop will still be simulated by X-Plane
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_torque_motors

children.description: Overrides all force calculations - write to LMN and g_nrml/side/axil.
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_forces

children.description: Overrides all wing calculations - write to aero LMN and g_nrml/side/axil.
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_wing_forces

children.description: Overrides all engine calculations - write to prop LMN and g_nrml/side/axil.
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_engine_forces

children.description: Overrides all gear calculations - write to gear LMN and g_nrml/side/axil.
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_gear_forces

children.description: Lets third party add-ons turn off X-Plane's map layer that shows icons for other planes. This allows the plugin to supply their own custom map layer and not conflict with X-Plane. Only writeable by the plugin that has also set override_TCAS.

children.description: Gives plugins control of sim/cockpit2/controls/left_brake_ratio and right_brake_ratio

children.description: Disable Austin's trucks.
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_ground_trucks

children.description: Overrides the sim's time step. When enabled, xtim.prd_sim, sim/operation/misc/frame_rate_period is plugin-writable

children.description: Override the sims pressurization control, so a plugin can control cabin pressurization itself.
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_pressurization

children.description: Override the sims crew and passenger oxygen system, so a plugin can control the oxygen system itself
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_oxygen_system

children.description: Override slung load size calculation - makes sim/flightmodel/misc/jett_size writable.

children.description: Overrides and turns off X-plane's simulation of wake turbulence
children.name: sim/operation/override/override_wake_turbulence

children.description: Overrides control of the refueling drogue.  Write to sim/flightmodel/drogue to control

children.description: Override GPU voltage, for specifying custom GPU cart behavior

children.description: Override the sims hydraulic system, so a plugin can control hydraulic pressure of all systems itself.

sim/aircraft2/
children.description: This section contains dataref access to the aircraft that has been auditied by LR for maintenance.  Unlike sim/aircraft/, if you can write these datarefs, it is safe to do so, and reading these datarefs makes sense.

children.name: sim/aircraft2/metadata/
children.description: This section contains read-only views of some of the current user's aircraft meta-data.
1 if the vehicle is categorized as an ultralight, 0 if it is not.
children.name: sim/aircraft2/metadata/is_ultralight

children.description: 1 if the vehicle is categorized as experimental, 0 if it is not.
children.name: sim/aircraft2/metadata/is_experimental

children.description: 1 if the vehicle is categorized as a general aviation aircraft, 0 if it is not.
children.name: sim/aircraft2/metadata/is_general_aviation

children.description: 1 if the vehicle is categorized as an airliner, 0 if it is not.
children.name: sim/aircraft2/metadata/is_airliner

children.description: 1 if the vehicle is categorized as a military aircraft, 0 if it is not.
children.name: sim/aircraft2/metadata/is_military

children.description: 1 if the vehicle is categorized as a cargo aircraft, 0 if it is not.
children.name: sim/aircraft2/metadata/is_cargo

children.description: 1 if the vehicle is categorized as a glider, 0 if it is not.
children.name: sim/aircraft2/metadata/is_glider

children.description: 1 if the vehicle is categorized as a seaplane, 0 if it is not.
children.name: sim/aircraft2/metadata/is_seaplane

children.description: 1 if the vehicle is categorized as a helicopter, 0 if it is not.
children.name: sim/aircraft2/metadata/is_helicopter

children.description: 1 if the vehicle is categorized as a VTOL, 0 if it is not.
children.name: sim/aircraft2/metadata/is_vtol

children.description: 1 if the vehicle is categorized as a science fiction aircraft, 0 if it is not.
children.name: sim/aircraft2/metadata/is_sci_fi

children.description: if 1, X-Plane treats the body as having been removed from the aircraft for physics.
children.name: sim/aircraft2/body/kill_body

children.description: The idle ratio for the engines at low idle.  1.0 provides default behavior; this can be any number greater than zero.
children.name: sim/aircraft2/engine/low_idle_ratio

children.description: The idle ratio for the engines at high idle. 1.0 provides default behavior; this can be any number greater than zero.
children.name: sim/aircraft2/engine/high_idle_ratio

children.description: The drag ratio for an engine's own internal friction and pumping losses. 1.0 for a recip engine provides default behavior of a Continental IO-550; this can be any number greater than zero.
children.name: sim/aircraft2/engine/engine_friction_ratio

children.name: sim/aircraft2/engine/max_power_limited_watts

children.description: Time for flaps to go from full retraction to full extension
children.name: sim/aircraft2/engine/flap_extension_time_sec

children.description: Time for flaps to go from full extension to full retraction
children.name: sim/aircraft2/engine/flap_retraction_time_sec

children.description: dirtiness of built-in exhaust effects, 1.0 is default, positive numbers are more dirty
children.name: sim/aircraft2/engine/exhaust_dirtiness_ratio
sim/cockpit2/
children.description: This section contains datarefs useful for custom cockpits.  Typically data is broken into indicators (what the pilot sees via instruments) and actuators (write to these to change what the plane does).  The actuators may not work when a failure happens, and the indicators may show false readings.  By using these datarefs, your cockpit will match the failure settings.

children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/
children.description: Annunciators, all are essentially indications.
This goes off any time there is a major problem with the bird: like it is on fire or something. This is an array of annunciators... kept as array for UDP IO
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/master_caution

children.description: This goes off whenever there is some more moderate problem with the bird... maybe lo fuel pressure ot qty
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/master_warning

children.description: Hit this button to CLEAR the master caution and warning: it says that you hear the buzzer and to shut it up already
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/master_accept

children.description: This goes off for a few moments when the autopilot disconnects.. you wanna KNOW if otto just quit on you!
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/autopilot_disconnect

children.description: The vacuum pressure, which drives the instruments in the old prop planes, is low: the artificial horizon may loose it is orientation!
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/low_vacuum

children.description: The voltage os too high or low on one of the electrical buses
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/low_voltage

children.description: Fuel qty. no points for guessing if it is too high or too low to trigger this one
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/fuel_quantity

children.description: Hydraulic pressure. should indicate if press is lo or hi
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/hydraulic_pressure

children.description: Speedbrake deployed: good to know so you do not forget it..
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/speedbrake

children.description: Ground proximity warning system: PULL UP! PULL UP! my lancair does this during my typical red-baron approaches!
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/GPWS

children.description: Ice detected on the plane.. most people agree this is NOT a good thing.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/ice

children.description: Rotor rpm on the helo has dropped below normal operating: power availability will be reduced!
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/low_rotor

children.description: Rotor rpm on the helo has exceeded normal operating: power availability will be reduced, and god knows if the blades will stay ON!
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/high_rotor

children.description: Pitot heat is OFF (YUP! OFF!) turn it on to heat up the pitot tube, which measures air pressure to give you air speed.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/pitot_heat

children.description: You are about to break the speed of sound when accelerating, or drop below the speed of sound if decelerating! the handling of the plane will change!
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/transonic

children.description: Slats deployed
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/slats

children.description: Flight director failure
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/flight_director

children.description: Autopilot failure
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/autopilot

children.description: Yaw damper failure
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/yaw_damper

children.description: Fuel pressure low - per engine
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/fuel_pressure_low

children.description: Fuel pressure low - per engine
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/oil_pressure_low

children.description: Oil temperature high - per engine
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/oil_temperature_high

children.description: Generator off - per engine
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/generator_off

children.description: Chip detected - per engine
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/chip_detected

children.description: Engine fire - per engine
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/engine_fires

children.description: Igniter on - per engine
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/igniter_on

children.description: Reverser on - per engine
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/reverser_on

children.description: Propeller in beta mode - per engine, double as NTS test light in fixed turboprops
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/beta

children.description: Burner on - per engine
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/burner_on

children.description: Inverter off - per 2 inverters
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/inverter_off

children.description: N1 of engine is too low for AC - per engine
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/N1_low

children.description: N1 too high - per engine
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/N1_high

children.description: Reversers not ready
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/reverser_not_ready

children.description: Ice vain extended (per engine)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/annunciators/ice_vane_extend

children.description: Ice vain failed (per engine)

children.description: Auto-throttle: -1=hard off, not even armed. 0=servos declutched (arm, hold), 1=airspeed hold, 2=N1 target hold, 3=retard, 4=reserved for future use

children.description: Manual trim required: 0=None, -1=Pitch down, 1=Pitch up

children.description: fail warn all lights on
children.name: sim/cockpit2/autopilot/otto_fail_warn

children.description: whether the autopilot is ready, but not actually turned on. This is true when the autopilot has powered, has no failures, and is ready to be engaged but not engaged yet.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/autopilot/otto_ready

children.description: momentarily indicates 1 for one frame when the autopilot is downgrading its level of automation or landing capabilities
children.name: sim/cockpit2/autopilot/downgrade

children.description: autopilot disconnect warning - like the annunicator, but suitable to trigger a sound because it doesn't light up when the annunicator lights are being tested.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/autopilot/autopilot_disconnect

children.description: autopilot trim fail warning - like the annunicator, but suitable to trigger a sound because it doesn't light up when the annunicator lights are being tested.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/autopilot/autopilot_trim_fail

children.description: Autopilot lateral mode. (0=roll, 1=heading sel, 2=nav, 10=TO/GA, 11=Re-entry, 12=Free, 13=GPSS, 14=heading hold, 15=turn-rate, 16=rollout, 18=track) Writeable with override only (sim/operation/override/override_autopilot)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/autopilot/heading_mode

children.description: Autopilot vertical mode. (3=pitch, 4=vertical speed, 5=level change, 6=altitude hold, 7=terrain follow, 8=glideslope, 9=VNAV path, 10=TO/GA, 11=Re-Entry, 12=Free, 17=Flare, 19=flight path angle, 20=VNAV speed) Writeable with override only (sim/operation/override/override_autopilot)

children.description: Maximum bank angle mode, 1->6. Higher number is steeper allowable bank.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/autopilot/bank_angle_mode

children.description: Array 0..5 for the maximum bank angle the autopilot can use in the selected bank_angle_mode. By default, this is 5, 10, 15, 20, 25 and 30 degrees of bank, but a plugin may modify these values.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/autopilot/bank_angles_values

children.description: Flight director mode, 0 is off, 1 is on, 2 is on with autopilot servos.  Good for the FD swich.

sim/cockpit2/controls/
children.description: All of the controls are effectiveley actuators.
How much the user input has deflected the yoke in the cockpit, in ratio, where -1.0 is full down, and 1.0 is full up.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/yoke_pitch_ratio

children.description: How much the user input has deflected the yoke in the cockpit, in ratio, where -1.0 is full left, and 1.0 is full right.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/yoke_roll_ratio

children.description: How much the user input has deflected the rudder in the cockpit, in ratio, where -1.0 is full left, and 1.0 is full right.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/yoke_heading_ratio

children.description: How much the copilot user input has deflected the yoke in the cockpit, in ratio, where -1.0 is full down, and 1.0 is full up.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/yoke_pitch_ratio_copilot

children.description: How much the copilot user input has deflected the yoke in the cockpit, in ratio, where -1.0 is full left, and 1.0 is full right.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/yoke_roll_ratio_copilot

children.description: How much the copilot user input has deflected the rudder in the cockpit, in ratio, where -1.0 is full left, and 1.0 is full right.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/yoke_heading_ratio_copilot

children.description: Total rudder control input (sum of user pedal plus autopilot servo plus artificial stability)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/total_heading_ratio

children.description: Total pitch control input (sum of user yoke plus autopilot servo plus artificial stability)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/total_pitch_ratio

children.description: Total roll control input (sum of user yoke plus autopilot servo plus artificial stability)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/total_roll_ratio

children.description: Total pitch control input copilot side (sum of user yoke plus autopilot servo plus artificial stability)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/total_pitch_ratio_copilot

children.description: Total roll control input copilot side(sum of user yoke plus autopilot servo plus artificial stability)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/total_roll_ratio_copilot

children.description: 0 = Normal: Left and right roll input are connected, 1 = Disconnected, each joystick roll input for pilot or copilot goes to the respective side.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/torque_tube_split_roll

children.description: 0 = Normal: Left and right pitch input are connected, 1 = Disconnected, each joystick pitch input for pilot or copilot goes to the respective side.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/torque_tube_split_pitch

children.description: 0 = Normal: left roll spoiler is controlled by left roll input, right roll spoiler is controlled by right roll input. 1 = Left: Both roll spoilers are controlled by the left aileron. 2 = Right: Both roll spoilers are controlled by the right aileron.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/roll_spoiler_actuation

children.description: How much the speebrake HANDLE is deflected, in ratio, where 0.0 is fully retracted, 0.5 is halfway down, and 1.0 is fully down, and -0.5 is speedbrakes ARMED.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/speedbrake_ratio

children.description: Requested sweep, in ratio. 0.0 is no sweep requested, 1 is max sweep requested.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/wingsweep_ratio

children.description: Requested thrust vector, in ratio. 0.0 is no thrust vector requested, 1 is max thrust vector requested.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/thrust_vector_ratio

children.description: Requested dihedral, in ratio. 0.0 is no dihedral requested, 1 is max dihedral requested.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/dihedral_ratio

children.description: Requested incidence, in ratio. 0.0 is no incidence requested, 1 is max incidence requested.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/incidence_ratio

children.description: Requested wing-retraction, in ratio. 0.0 is no wing-retraction requested, 1 is max wing-retraction requested.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/wing_retraction_ratio

children.description: Use flap_handle_request_ratio
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/flap_ratio

children.description: The ACTUAL FLAP deployment for overall flap system, in ratio, where 0.0 is flaps fully retracted, and 1.0 is flaps fully extended. Use the deployment for flap set 1 or flap set 2 to deflect the surfaces though. This takes into account that flaps deploy slowly, not instantaneously as the handle is dragged.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/flap_system_deploy_ratio

children.description: The flap HANDLE location, in ratio, where 0.0 is handle fully retracted, and 1.0 is handle fully extended.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/flap_handle_request_ratio

children.description: The flap extension in degrees that should be achieved when the handle is placed in the dial-a-flap position of the flap lever, if configured.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/flap_dial_a_flap

children.description: If the aircraft is so equipped, provides readout of the Slat/flap configuration: 0=CONF 0, 1=CONF 1, 2=CONF 1+F, 3=CONF 1*, 4=CONF 2, 5=CONF 2*, 6=CONF 3, 7=CONF FULL
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/flap_config

children.description: Slats prevented from retracting because of AOA or speed condition.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/slat_lock_active

children.description: Flap position currently disagrees with the position requested by the flap lever. 0=flaps agree,1=flaps disagree,2=flaps disagree because of load relief
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/flap_disagree

children.description: Slat position currently disagrees with the position requested by the slat/flap lever. 0=slats agree,1=slats disagree,2=slats disagree because of alpha lock
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/slat_disagree

children.description: The overall brake requested by the parking brake button... 0.0 is none, 1.0 is complete.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/parking_brake_ratio

children.description: Additional left brake requested by pedal deflection, 0.0 to 1.0.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/left_brake_ratio

children.description: Additional right brake requested by pedal deflection, 0.0 to 1.0.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/right_brake_ratio

children.description: Gear handle position. 0 is up. 1 is down.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/gear_handle_down

children.description: Gear handle position as float for lever animation. 0 is up, 1 is down, 0.5 is off (for planes that have that).
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/gear_handle_animation

children.description: Gear handle request. 0 is up, 1 is down, -1 is off. Not writeable, use commands sim/flight_controls/landing_gear_[down/up/toggle/off]
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/gear_handle_request

children.description: Gear handle downlock release. If this is 1, the gear handle can be moved to up even if the squat switch reports weight on wheels
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/gear_handle_downlock_release

children.description: Is the nosewheel steering turned on? 0 or 1.  This must be off AND the tail wheel must be unlocked to free castor.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/nosewheel_steer_on

children.description: Brake fan switch on for cooling the brakes down faster
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/brake_fan_on

children.description: Tail-wheel lockig ratio. 0 for free-castoring, 1 for totally locked.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/tailwheel_lock_ratio

children.description: Aileron trim, in part of MAX FLIGHT CONTROL DEFLECTION. So, if the aileron trim is deflected enough to move the ailerons through 30% of their travel, then that is an aileron trim of 0.3. -1=left 1=right
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/aileron_trim

children.description: Elevator trim, in part of MAX FLIGHT CONTROL DEFLECTION. So, if the elevator trim is deflected enough to move the elevators through 30% of their travel, then that is an elevator trim of 0.3. -1=down 1=up
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/elevator_trim

children.description: Rudder trim, in part of MAX FLIGHT CONTROL DEFLECTION. So, if the rudder trim is deflected enough to move the rudders through 30% of their travel, then that is an rudder trim of 0.3. -1=left 1=right
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/rudder_trim

children.description: Rotor trim, in part of MAX FLIGHT CONTROL DEFLECTION. So, if the rotor trim is deflected enough to move the rotor through 30% of its travel, then that is a rotor trim of 0.3. -1=down 1=up
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/rotor_trim

children.description: Deployment of the water rudder, 0 is none, 1 is max
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/water_rudder_handle_ratio

children.description: How far the indicator of flap deployment has moved in the cockpit.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/controls/flap_handle_deploy_ratio

sim/cockpit2/engine/
children.description: Engine cockpit datarefs

children.name: sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/
children.description: Controls for each engine. All array(16) types were array(8) before XP12.
Longitudinal cyclic COMMAND, in degrees. Positive forwards cyclic.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/cyclic_elevator_deg

children.description: Lateral cyclic COMMAND, in degrees. Positive right cyclic.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/cyclic_aileron_deg

children.description: Throttle position of the handle itself, from 0.0 (idle) to 1.0 (max normal).
children.name: sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/throttle_ratio

children.description: Throttle position of the handle as a ratio with reverse and beta, -2..-1 = rev, -1..0=beta, 0..1=alpha
children.name: sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/throttle_beta_rev_ratio

children.description: Throttle position of the handle as a ratio with reverse, -1..0 = rev, 0..1=fwd
children.name: sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/throttle_jet_rev_ratio

children.description: Throttle position of the handle as a ratio, 0.0 is minimum beta, 1.0 = maximum beta.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/beta_ratio

children.description: Throttle position of the handle itself - this controls all the handles at once.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/throttle_ratio_all

children.description: Controls the throttle handle position, but includes beta and reverse.  -2..-1 is reverse, -1..0 is beta, 0..1 is alpha.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/throttle_beta_rev_ratio_all

children.description: Controls the throttle handle position, but includes reverse.  -1..0 is reverse, 0..1 is fwd.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/throttle_jet_rev_ratio_all

children.description: Prop handle position, in radians per second of requested prop rpm.  Use this if your plane has a constant speed prop.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/prop_rotation_speed_rad_sec

children.description: Prop handle position, this controls all props at once.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/prop_rotation_speed_rad_sec_all

children.description: Prop handle position, in degrees.  Use this if your plane has a manual-adjust prop.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/prop_angle_degrees

children.description: Prop handle position, in degrees, set all at once.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/prop_angle_degrees_all

children.description: Prop handle position, in ratio. NOTE: This is also used for helicopter collective!
children.name: sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/prop_ratio

children.description: Prop handle position, in ratio. This controls all handles at once. NOTE: This is also used for helicopter collective!
children.name: sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/prop_ratio_all

children.description: Mixture handle position, 0.0 (cutoff) to 1.0 (full rich).
children.name: sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/mixture_ratio

children.description: Mixture handle position, this controls all at once.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/mixture_ratio_all

children.description: Carb-heat handle position, 0.0 (none) to 1.0 (full).
children.name: sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/carb_heat_ratio

children.description: Cowl-flap handle position, 0.0 (none) to 1.0 (full open).
children.name: sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/cowl_flap_ratio

children.description: Primer handle position, 0.0 (none) to 1.0 (on).
children.name: sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/primer_ratio

children.description: Afterburner enabled, on or off.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/afterburner_enabled

children.description: 0 = Norm, -1 = Crank, 1 = Ign/Start
children.name: sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/eng_mode_selector

children.description: Engine Master switch ON/OFF for engines that require the mode selector
children.name: sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/eng_master

children.description: Igniter, on or off.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/igniter_on

children.description: Auto-igniter switch, 0 or 1. Auto-ignition. This switch turns on a continuous ignition source in the engine to automatically relight it if there is a flameout.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/auto_ignite_on

children.description: 0 = off, 1 = left, 2 = right, 3 = both
children.name: sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/ignition_on

children.description: 0 = off, 1 = left, 2 = right, 3 = both, 4 = starting. The dataref is spring-loaded for starter. You have to keep setting it to start in order to keep cranking.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/ignition_key

children.description: True while the starter motor is engaged
children.name: sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/starter_hit

children.description: Fadec, ok or off.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/fadec_on

children.description: Primer button, on or off.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/primer_on

children.description: Fuel pump, on or off.  This is the electric per-engine fuel pump! 0=off, 1=on (high), 2=auto (pressure-triggered)

children.description: rotor-driven hydraulic pump, per prop index, not engine, system B. This is found on helicopters, to keep hydraulic pressure up in auto-rotation

sim/cockpit2/ice/
children.description: Actuators for ice switches
De-ice switch, 0 or 1. De-ice - all systems. This is the master switch for the de-icing systems.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_all_on

children.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - inlet heat. This switch turns on de-icing heat in the engine air inlet keep ice from choking your engine. Engine 1 only
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_inlet_heat_on

children.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - prop heat. This switch turns on de-icing of the propeller(s) to keep ice from building up on your prop. Engine 1 only
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_prop_heat_on

children.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - inlet heat. This switch turns on de-icing heat in the engine air inlet keep ice from choking your engine.  Per engine
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_inlet_heat_on_per_engine

children.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - prop heat. This switch turns on de-icing of the propeller(s) to keep ice from building up on your prop.  Per engine
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_prop_heat_on_per_engine

children.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - windshield heat. This switch turns on windshield de-icing to keep ice from blocking your vision.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_window_heat_on

children.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - windshield heat. This switch turns on windshield de-icing to keep ice from blocking your vision.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_window_heat_on_window

children.description: Tells whether the de-ice of the given window is actually running, taking into account possible failures.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_window_heat_running

children.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - pitot tube heat. This switch turns on de-icing heat in the pitot tube. If it freezes up your airspeed indicator and altimeter stop working. Airspeed and altitude related autopilot functions are also affected.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_pitot_heat_on_pilot

children.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  Pitot tube heat, co-pilot. This switch turns on de-icing heat in the co-pilot side pitot tube. If it freezes up your airspeed indicator and altimeter stop working. Airspeed and altitude related autopilot functions are also affected.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_pitot_heat_on_copilot

children.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  Pitot tube heat, standby pitot. This switch turns on de-icing heat for the standby instruments pitot tube. If it freezes up your airspeed indicator and altimeter stop working. Airspeed and altitude related autopilot functions are also affected.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_pitot_heat_on_standby

children.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  AOA sensor heat. This switch turns on de-icing heat for the AOA sensor. If it freezes up your AOA indicator stops working. AOA sensor failure will also affect the aircraft's artificial stability system if it has one.  Pilot.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_AOA_heat_on

children.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  AOA sensor heat. This switch turns on de-icing heat for the AOA sensor. If it freezes up your AOA indicator stops working. AOA sensor failure will also affect the aircraft's artificial stability system if it has one.  Copilot.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_AOA_heat_on_copilot

children.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  Static port heat. This switch turns on de-icing heat for the static sensor. If it freezes up your altimeter, vvi and airspeed indicator stop working. Pilot.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_static_heat_on_pilot

children.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  Static port heat. This switch turns on de-icing heat for the static sensor. If it freezes up your altimeter, vvi and airspeed indicator stop working. Copilot.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_static_heat_on_copilot

children.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  Static port heat. This switch turns on de-icing heat for the static sensor. If it freezes up your altimeter, vvi and airspeed indicator stop working. Standby instruments.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_static_heat_on_standby

children.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - electric heat. This switch engages electrically heated leading edges. (All wings)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_surfce_heat_on

children.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - electric heat. This switch engages electrically heated leading edges. (Left wing)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_surfce_heat_left_on

children.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - electric heat. This switch engages electrically heated leading edges. (Right wing)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_surfce_heat_right_on

children.description: De-ice switch, 0, 1, 2, 3.  De-ice - pneumatic. This switch inflates flexible bladders on the wing leading edges to pop off accumulated ice. 0 = Off, 1 = Continuous, 2 = Single/Auto (deflates automatically), 3 = Man (deflates when switch let go) (All wings)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_surface_boot_on

children.description: De-ice switch, 0, 1, 2, 3.  De-ice - pneumatic. This switch inflates flexible bladders on the wing leading edges to pop off accumulated ice. 0 = Off, 1 = Continuous, 2 = Single/Auto (deflates automatically), 3 = Man (deflates when switch let go) (Left wing)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_surface_boot_left_on

children.description: De-ice switch, 0, 1, 2, 3.  De-ice - pneumatic. This switch inflates flexible bladders on the wing leading edges to pop off accumulated ice. 0 = Off, 1 = Continuous, 2 = Single/Auto (deflates automatically), 3 = Man (deflates when switch let go) (Right wing)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_surface_boot_right_on

children.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - bleed air. This switch directs warm air from the engines into the wing leading edges to keep them free of ice. (All wings)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_surface_hot_bleed_air_on

children.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - bleed air. This switch directs warm air from the engines into the wing leading edges to keep them free of ice. (Left wing)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_surface_hot_bleed_air_left_on

children.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - bleed air. This switch directs warm air from the engines into the wing leading edges to keep them free of ice. (Right wing)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_surface_hot_bleed_air_right_on

children.description: Wing anti-ice bleed air is normally provided by the on-side engine (i.e. the left wing gets hot bleed air from the left engine's ductwork). By opening this valve, either engine can provide wing anti-ice by means of HP air, even if the LP isolation valve(s) are closed.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_wing_hot_bleed_air_crossover_valve

children.description: De-ice switch, 0, 1, or 2.  De-ice - TKS fluid. This switch activates the pump for the weeping wing, dissipating TKS fluid on the leading edges to keep them free of ice. 0 = Off, 1 = Norm, 2 = High. (All wings)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_surface_tks_on

children.description: De-ice switch, 0, 1, or 2.  De-ice - TKS fluid. This switch activates the pump for the weeping wing, dissipating TKS fluid on the leading edges to keep them free of ice. 0 = Off, 1 = Norm, 2 = High. (Left wing)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_surface_tks_left_on

children.description: De-ice switch, 0, 1, or 2.  De-ice - TKS fluid. This switch activates the pump for the weeping wing, dissipating TKS fluid on the leading edges to keep them free of ice. 0 = Off, 1 = Norm, 2 = High. (Right wing)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_surface_tks_right_on

children.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - inlet heat. This switch turns on thermal anti ice of the engine cowling and inlet. This takes hot bleed air from the HP compressor.  Per engine
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/cowling_thermal_anti_ice_per_engine

children.description: De-ice switch, 0, 1, or 2.  De-ice - prop TKS. This switch turns on de-icing of the propeller(s) with TKS fluid to keep ice from building up on your prop. 0 = Off, 1 = Norm, 2 = High. Per engine
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_prop_tks_on_per_engine

children.description: De-icing boots inflation ratio, left and right wing
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_wing_boots_inflation

children.description: De-ice tailplane automatically with wing/airframe deice, or separately with new datarefs. 0 = Auto, Default for all planes: Tail is deiced with whatever acts on the wings. 1 = Man: Tailplane de-ice is no longer slaved and must be turned on with separate datarefs.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_tailplane_man

children.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - electric heat. This switch engages electrically heated leading edges. (All tailplanes)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_tail_heat_on

children.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - electric heat. This switch engages electrically heated leading edges. (Left tailplanes)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_tail_heat_left_on

children.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - electric heat. This switch engages electrically heated leading edges. (Right tailplanes)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_tail_heat_right_on

children.description: De-ice switch, 0, 1, 2, 3.  De-ice - pneumatic. This switch inflates flexible bladders on the wing leading edges to pop off accumulated ice. 0 = Off, 1 = Continuous, 2 = Single/Auto (deflates automatically), 3 = Man (deflates when switch let go) (All tailplanes)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_tail_boot_on

children.description: De-ice switch, 0, 1, 2, 3.  De-ice - pneumatic. This switch inflates flexible bladders on the wing leading edges to pop off accumulated ice. 0 = Off, 1 = Continuous, 2 = Single/Auto (deflates automatically), 3 = Man (deflates when switch let go) (Left tailplanes)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_tail_boot_left_on

children.description: De-ice switch, 0, 1, 2, 3.  De-ice - pneumatic. This switch inflates flexible bladders on the wing leading edges to pop off accumulated ice. 0 = Off, 1 = Continuous, 2 = Single/Auto (deflates automatically), 3 = Man (deflates when switch let go) (Right tailplanes)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_tail_boot_right_on

children.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - bleed air. This switch directs warm air from the engines into the tailplane leading edges to keep them free of ice. (All tailplanes)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_tail_hot_bleed_air_on

children.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - bleed air. This switch directs warm air from the engines into the tailplane leading edges to keep them free of ice. (Left tailplanes)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_tail_hot_bleed_air_left_on

children.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - bleed air. This switch directs warm air from the engines into the tailplane leading edges to keep them free of ice. (Right tailplanes)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_tail_hot_bleed_air_right_on

children.description: De-ice switch, 0, 1, or 2.  De-ice - TKS fluid. This switch activates the pump for the weeping wing, dissipating TKS fluid on the leading edges to keep them free of ice. 0 = Off, 1 = Norm, 2 = High. (All tailplanes)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_tail_tks_on

children.description: De-ice switch, 0, 1, or 2.  De-ice - TKS fluid. This switch activates the pump for the weeping wing, dissipating TKS fluid on the leading edges to keep them free of ice. 0 = Off, 1 = Norm, 2 = High. (Left tailplanes)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_tail_tks_left_on

children.description: De-ice switch, 0, 1, or 2.  De-ice - TKS fluid. This switch activates the pump for the weeping wing, dissipating TKS fluid on the leading edges to keep them free of ice. 0 = Off, 1 = Norm, 2 = High. (Right tailplanes)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_tail_tks_right_on

children.description: De-icing boots inflation ratio, left and right tailplane
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_tail_boots_inflation

children.description: De-Ice ratio.  (Description needed)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/anti_ice_engine_air

children.description: De-Ice ratio.  (Description needed)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/anti_ice_engine_air_b

children.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  De-ice - auto-ignition. This switch turns on a continuous ignition source in the engine to automatically relight it if there is a flameout. Use sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/auto_ignite_on
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_auto_ignite_on

children.description: De-ice switch, 0 or 1.  Ice-detection: Turn this switch on to enable ice-detection... if the system detects ice, it will light up the ICE annunciator.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_detect_on

children.description: TKS de-icing fluid reserve. See sim/aircraft/specialcontrols/acf_tks_cap_liter for the plane's total capacity.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_tks_fluid_liter

children.description: Backup pump selected permanently on for TKS FIKI
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/tks_backup_pump

children.description: Timer for TKS FIKI max flow rate (counts down from 2 minutes)
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/tks_max_time_left

children.description: Holdover time left in minutes until ground de-icing becomes ineffective.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/ice/ice_deice_holdover_time_left_minutes
sim/cockpit2/pressurization/
children.description: Control for cabin pressurization
Bleed air mode, 0=of, 1=left,2=both,3=right,4=apu,5=auto
children.name: sim/cockpit2/pressurization/actuators/bleed_air_mode

children.description: Dump all pressurization, 0 or 1.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/pressurization/actuators/dump_all_on

children.description: Dump pressurization to the current altitude, 0 or 1.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/pressurization/actuators/dump_to_altitude_on

children.description: Cabin altitude commanded, feet.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/pressurization/actuators/cabin_altitude_ft

children.description: Cabin VVI commanded, feet.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/pressurization/actuators/cabin_vvi_fpm

children.description: Maximum allowable altitude for this airplane to maintain the requested cabin altitude.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/pressurization/actuators/max_allowable_altitude_ft

children.description: Electrical air conditioning compressor on, consuming all the amps of rel_HVAC - not needed on airplanes with air cycle machines that drive the air conditioner off the bleed air power itself.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/pressurization/actuators/air_cond_on

children.description: Electrical heater grid on, 0 = off, 1 = flight max (consumes rel_HVAC amps), 2 = ground max (consumes 2x rel_HVAC amps, turned off by weight-off-wheels) - not needed on airplanes that are using hot bleed air and have no heaters
children.name: sim/cockpit2/pressurization/actuators/heater_on

children.description: Electric fan (vent blower) setting, consuming 0.1 of rel_HVAVC amps when running. 0 = Auto (Runs whenever air_cond_on or heater_on is on), 1 = Low, 2 = High
children.name: sim/cockpit2/pressurization/actuators/fan_setting

children.description: Cabin altitude actually occurring, feet.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/pressurization/indicators/cabin_altitude_ft

children.description: Cabin VVI actually occurring, fpm.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/pressurization/indicators/cabin_vvi_fpm

children.description: Cabin differential pressure, psi.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/pressurization/indicators/pressure_diffential_psi

children.description: Pressurization outflow valve ratio. 0 for fully closed, 1 for fully open. Writeable with override_pressurization
children.name: sim/cockpit2/pressurization/indicators/outflow_valve

children.description: Electric fan speed, will be 1.0 or 2.0 depending on fan setting or 0 when there's no power or the fan is turned off. Writeable with override_pressurization
children.name: sim/cockpit2/pressurization/indicators/fan_speed
sim/cockpit2/bleedair/
children.description: Control for bleed air, pneumatics which are used for anti-ice and for cabin pressurization
Engine bleed air shut off valve, close or open
children.name: sim/cockpit2/bleedair/actuators/engine_bleed_sov

children.description: APU bleed air valve, close or open. APU must be running at 100%N1 to provide bleed air
children.name: sim/cockpit2/bleedair/actuators/apu_bleed

children.description: GPU bleed air valve, close or open. A GPU is supposed to be always available.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/bleedair/actuators/gpu_bleed

children.description: Isolation Valve for left duct, close or open. This separates all engines on the left side of the plane, the left wing, and the left pack from the rest of the system
children.name: sim/cockpit2/bleedair/actuators/isol_valve_left

children.description: Isolation Valve for right duct, close or open. This separates all engines on the right side of the plane, the right wing, and the right pack from the rest of the system
children.name: sim/cockpit2/bleedair/actuators/isol_valve_right

children.description: Instrument Air venturi actuated from engine bleed air, left engine
children.name: sim/cockpit2/bleedair/actuators/instrument_air_left

children.description: Instrument Air venturi actuated from engine bleed air, right engine
children.name: sim/cockpit2/bleedair/actuators/instrument_air_right

children.description: Left pressurization pack, off or on. The left pack is supplied from the left side of the plane or through the left isolation valve and only available for airplanes made for 11.35 or newer
children.name: sim/cockpit2/bleedair/actuators/pack_left

children.description: Center pressurization pack, off or on. The center pack is supplied from center duct, which can be supplied from a center engine, APU, GPU, or, via the isolation valves, the left and/or right ducts. This pack is the only pack available for airplanes made for X-Plane 11.33 or older
children.name: sim/cockpit2/bleedair/actuators/pack_center

children.description: Right pressurization pack, off or on. The right pack is supplied from the right side of the plane or through the right isolation valve and only available for airplanes made for 11.35 or newer
children.name: sim/cockpit2/bleedair/actuators/pack_right

children.description: Bleed air available in the left duct, which can come from left engines or through the left isolation valve. Writeable with override (override_pressurization).
children.name: sim/cockpit2/bleedair/indicators/bleed_available_left

children.description: Bleed air available in the center duct, which can come from a center engine, APU, GPU, or, via the isolation valves, the left and/or right ducts. Writeable with override (override_pressurization).
children.name: sim/cockpit2/bleedair/indicators/bleed_available_center

children.description: Bleed air available in the right duct, which can come from right engines or through the right isolation valve. Writeable with override (override_pressurization).
children.name: sim/cockpit2/bleedair/indicators/bleed_available_right

children.description: Bleed air being sapped from the engine, stealing efficiency from the compressor. Engine feels like induction air is this much warmer than ambient. Writeable only with override_pressurization set
children.name: sim/cockpit2/bleedair/indicators/engine_loss_from_bleed_air_ratio

children.description: Bleed air being sapped from the APU, stealing efficiency from the compressor. Engine feels like induction air is this much warmer than ambient. Writeable only with override_pressurization set
children.name: sim/cockpit2/bleedair/indicators/APU_loss_from_bleed_air_ratio
sim/cockpit2/oxygen/
children.description: Control for crew and passenger oxygen systems
crew oxygen valve open
children.name: sim/cockpit2/oxygen/actuators/o2_valve_on

children.description: 0 = off, 1 = unregulated, 2 = now/night, 3 = day/delay 5, 4 = day/delay 10, 5 = fat/face mask 1, 6 = fat/face mask 2, 7 = fat/face mask 3, 8 = fat/face mask 4
children.name: sim/cockpit2/oxygen/actuators/demand_flow_setting

children.description: number of people plugged into the bottle O2 system - note that airliners usually have a chemical oxygen system, so this is for the two pilots, while the PAX a served by a chemical oxygenator
children.name: sim/cockpit2/oxygen/actuators/num_plugged_in_o2

children.description: liters of O2 remaining in the crew bottle. Writeable with override_oxygen_system
children.name: sim/cockpit2/oxygen/indicators/o2_bottle_rem_liter

children.description: pressure in the O2 bottle. Writeable with override_oxygen_system
children.name: sim/cockpit2/oxygen/indicators/o2_bottle_pressure_psi

children.description: pressure altitude felt by the pilot's body. Will be lower than cabin pressure altitude when on oxygen. This is what triggers the hypoxia black-out effect. Writeable with override_oxygen_system
children.name: sim/cockpit2/oxygen/indicators/pilot_felt_altitude_ft

children.description: passenger chemical oxygen generator on and supplying passengers' O2 masks. Note that the dataref to drop the masks manually is sim/operation/failures/rel_pass_o2_on
children.name: sim/cockpit2/oxygen/indicators/pass_oxygenator_working

children.description: the chemical oxygen generator can still supply the passenger oxygen masks with O2 for this many minutes
children.name: sim/cockpit2/oxygen/indicators/pass_oxygenator_min_rem

children.name: sim/cockpit2/radios/indicators/fac

children.name: sim/cockpit2/radios/indicators/ltp_id

children.name: sim/cockpit2/radios/indicators/ltp_dist_nm

children.name: sim/cockpit2/radios/indicators/fas_has_dme

children.description: Copilot FMS: Final Approach Segment ID, such as 'IFNW', 'W05A', 'G25A', 'RNV23LY' depending on type of approach being flown
children.name: sim/cockpit2/radios/indicators/fas_id_copilot

children.description: Copilot FMS: Final Approach Course

children.description: Copilot FMS: Landing Threshold Point ID, or 'DME' in case of ILS approach
children.name: sim/cockpit2/radios/indicators/ltp_id_copilot

children.description: Copilot FMS: Distance to Landing Threshold Point or ILS-DME.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/radios/indicators/ltp_dist_nm_copilot

children.name: sim/cockpit2/radios/indicators/fas_has_dme_copilot

children.description: Barometric altitude (MSL) of the selected takeoff or landing runway.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/radios/indicators/landing_alt_pilot

children.description: Copilot FMS: Barometric altitude (MSL) of the selected takeoff or landing runway.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/radios/indicators/landing_alt_copilot

children.description: Height above threshold: Barometric height difference between landing threshold and current altitude. This is not equal to radio altimeter! Radio altimeter sees hills before the airport, this doesn't!
children.name: sim/cockpit2/radios/indicators/HAT_pilot

children.description: Copilot FMS: Height above threshold: Barometric height difference between landing threshold and current altitude. This is not equal to radio altimeter! Radio altimeter sees hills before the airport, this doesn't!
children.name: sim/cockpit2/radios/indicators/HAT_copilot

sim/cockpit2/switches/
children.description: These are all actuators.
Switch, 0 or 1.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/avionics_power_on

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1. This is to turn COM1 on to get a clearance without turning the rest of the avionics on.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/gnd_com_power_on

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/navigation_lights_on

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/beacon_on

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/strobe_lights_on

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1.  This affects the first landing light.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/landing_lights_on

children.description: Switch, 0 is off, 0.5 is half-intensity, etc. for any of the landing lights.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/landing_lights_switch

children.description: Switch, 0 is off, 0.5 is half-intensity, etc. for any of the generic lights.  Was [64] until 11.10
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/generic_lights_switch

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/taxi_light_on

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/spot_light_on

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/dump_fuel

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/puffers_on

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/prop_sync_on

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1. fan=0, off=1, turbine=2 sync engines when RPM of spools are close
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/jet_sync_mode

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1. electric hydro-pressure pump
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/electric_hydraulic_pump_on

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1. electric hydro-pressure pump #2
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/electric_hydraulic_pump2_on

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1. ram air turbine (the rat) when total failure
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/ram_air_turbine_on

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/yaw_damper_on

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/artificial_stability_on

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/artificial_stability_pitch_on

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/artificial_stability_roll_on

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/HUD_on

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/parachute_deploy

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/jato_on

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/tailhook_deploy

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/canopy_open

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1. 0 is closed, 1 is open
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/door_open

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/water_scoop_deploy

children.description: This will be set to true when water is in the process of dumping out of a water-bomber.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/dump_water

children.description: No Smoking
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/no_smoking

children.description: Fasten Seat Belts
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/fasten_seat_belts

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/total_energy_audio

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/HSI_is_arc

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/HSI_is_arc_copilot

children.description: Switch, 0 is RTO (Rejected Take-Off), 1 is off, 2->5 are increasing auto-brake levels.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/auto_brake_level

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/auto_reverse_on

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/prop_feather_mode

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/pre_rotate_level

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1 - engage/disengage rotor clutch
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/clutch_engage

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1 - turns on the rotor brake.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/rotor_brake

children.description: Switch, 0 or 1 - turns on hotel mode on free turbines.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/hotel_mode

children.description: Relative strength of the rotor brake compared to X-Plane default.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/rotor_brake_ratio

children.description: Relative strength of the hotel mode brake compared to X-Plane default.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/hotel_mode_ratio

children.description: Current clutch ratio, 0.0 is off, 1.0 is on - follows clutch engage with some lag.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/clutch_ratio

children.description: This will have an enumeration based on the direction of fire of any maneuvering rockets.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/rocket_mode

children.description: This can be 0 (half-power afterburners) or 1 (full-power burner).
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/burner_level

children.description: Alternate static air ratio, 0.0 is off, 1,.0 is on.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/alternate_static_air_ratio

children.description: 0=off,1=25%speed,2=50%speed,3=100%speed.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/wiper_speed

children.description: 0=park, 1=25%speed,2=50%speed,3=100%speed.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/wiper_speed_switch

children.description: Rain repellent other than wipers. Blower, bleed air, chemicals, etc.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/rain_repellent_switch

children.description: custom sliders.  When flipped, slider moves based on timing in planemaker.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/custom_slider_on

children.description: Rheostat controlling panel brightness.  0 = flood, 1-3 = spot lights.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/panel_brightness_ratio

children.description: Rheostat controlling instruments brightnesss.  0 = default pilot, 1 = default copilot, 2-15 = custom - was [16] until 11.10
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/instrument_brightness_ratio

children.description: Rheostat controlling HUD brightness.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/HUD_brightness_ratio

children.description: Camera power on
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/camera_power_on

children.description: Variometer audio on
children.name: sim/cockpit2/switches/total_energy_audio_on

children.description: Relative bearing of each other plane in degrees for TCAS - relative to sim/flightmodel/position/true_psi not ground track or anything else
children.name: sim/cockpit2/tcas/indicators/relative_bearing_degs

children.description: Distance to each other plane in meters for TCAS
children.name: sim/cockpit2/tcas/indicators/relative_distance_mtrs

children.description: Relative altitude (positive means above us) for TCAS
children.name: sim/cockpit2/tcas/indicators/relative_altitude_mtrs

children.description: True if a TCAS alert is currently issued.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/tcas/indicators/tcas_alert

children.description: If TCAS is not overriden by plgugin, returns the number of planes in X-Plane, which might be under plugin control or X-Plane control. If TCAS is overriden, returns how many targets are actually being written to with the override. These are not necessarily consecutive entries in the TCAS arrays.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/tcas/indicators/tcas_num_acf

children.description: 24bit (0-16777215 or 0 - 0xFFFFFF) unique ID of the airframe. This is also known as the ADS-B 'hexcode'.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/modeS_id

children.description: Mode C transponder code 0000 to 7777. This is not really an integer, this is an octal number.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/modeC_code

children.description: 7 character Flight ID, terminated by 0 byte. ICAO flightplan item 7.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/flight_id

children.description: 7 character ICAO code, terminated by 0 byte. C172, B738, etc... see https://www.icao.int/publications/DOC8643/Pages/Search.aspx
children.name: sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/icao_type

children.description: Transponder mode: off=0, stdby=1, on (mode A)=2, alt (mode C)=3, test=4, GND (mode S)=5, ta_only (mode S)=6, ta/ra=7
children.name: sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/ssr_mode

children.description: local X coordinate, meter. Writeable only when override_TCAS is set.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/position/x

children.description: local Y coordinate, meter. Writeable only when override_TCAS is set.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/position/y

children.description: local Z coordinate, meter. Writeable only when override_TCAS is set.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/position/z

children.description: global coordinate, degrees.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/position/lat

children.description: global coordinate, degrees.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/position/lon

children.description: global coordinate, meter.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/position/ele

children.description: local X velocity. Writeable only when override_TCAS is set.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/position/vx

children.description: local Y velocity. Writeable only when override_TCAS is set.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/position/vy

children.description: local Z velocity. Writeable only when override_TCAS is set.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/position/vz

children.description: absolute vertical speed feet per minute. Writeable only when override_TCAS is set.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/position/vertical_speed

children.description: ground track in true degrees. Derived from velocity vector.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/position/hpath

children.description: flight path angle in degrees. Derived from velocity vector.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/position/vpath

children.description: total true speed, norm of local velocity vector. That means it includes vertical speed!
children.name: sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/position/V_msc

children.description: true heading orientation. Writeable only when override_TCAS is set.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/position/psi

children.description: pitch angle. Writeable only when override_TCAS is set.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/position/the

children.description: bank angle. Writeable only when override_TCAS is set.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/position/phi

children.description: ground/flight logic. Writeable only when override_TCAS is set.
children.name: sim/cockpit2/tcas/targets/position/weight_on_wheels
