sim/flightmodel2/
children.description: The flightmodel2 section contains data about how the actual aircraft is being drawn.  Use this section to build animated objects for the aircraft.  Do not use these datarefs in the cockpit.

children.name: sim/flightmodel2/controls/
children.description: This section contains general control surface values for the whole plane.  These are the actual control movements, e.g. if the control efficacy is reduced by low hydraulic pressure, these show what actually moved, not what the pilot wants.
0=Normal, 1=Alternate, 2=Direct, only updated if acf is equipped with Airbus flight controls.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/controls/airbus_law

children.description: Low-speed condition, 5 degrees below alpha-max, only updated if acf is equipped with Airbus flight controls.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/controls/airbus_speed_warn_thro_0

children.description: Low-speed condition, 5 degrees below alpha-max, only updated if acf is equipped with Airbus flight controls.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/controls/airbus_speed_warn_thro_1

children.description: How much the flight controls are deflected in pitch after any stability augmentation, in ratio, where -1.0 is full down, and 1.0 is full up.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/controls/pitch_ratio

children.description: How much the flight controls are deflected in roll after any stability augmentation, in ratio, where -1.0 is full left, and 1.0 is full right.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/controls/roll_ratio

children.description: How much the flight controls are deflected in heading after any stability augmentation, where -1.0 is full left, and 1.0 is full right.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/controls/heading_ratio

children.description: Right wings only: This is how much the flight controls are deflected in pitch after any stability augmentation, in ratio, where -1.0 is full down, and 1.0 is full up.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/controls/pitch_ratio_right

children.description: Right wings only: This is how much the flight controls are deflected in roll after any stability augmentation, in ratio, where -1.0 is full left, and 1.0 is full right.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/controls/roll_ratio_right

children.description: How much the speedbrakes surfaces are extended, in ratio, where 0.0 is fully retracted, and 1.0 is fully extended.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/controls/speedbrake_ratio

children.description: Actual sweep, in ratio. 0.0 is no sweep deployment, 1 is max sweep deployment.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/controls/wingsweep_ratio

children.description: Actual thrust vector, in ratio. 0.0 is no thrust vector deployment, 1 is max thrust vector deployment.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/controls/thrust_vector_ratio

children.description: Actual dihedral, in ratio. 0.0 is no dihedral deployment, 1 is max dihedral deployment.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/controls/dihedral_ratio

children.description: Actual incidence, in ratio. 0.0 is no incidence deployment, 1 is max incidence deployment.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/controls/incidence_ratio

children.description: Actual wing-retraction, in ratio. 0.0 is no wing-retraction deployment, 1 is max wing-retraction deployment.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/controls/wing_retraction_ratio

children.description: Use sim/cockpit2/controls/flap_system_deploy_ratio
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/controls/flap_handle_deploy_ratio

children.description: Slat deployment, where 0.0 is slats fully retracted, 1.0 is slats fully extended. This variable applies to lading-edge flaps as well.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/controls/slat1_deploy_ratio

children.description: Slat deployment, where 0.0 is slats fully retracted, 1.0 is slats fully extended. This variable applies to lading-edge flaps as well.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/controls/slat2_deploy_ratio

children.description: ACTUAL FLAP deployment for flap-set #1, in ratio, where 0.0 is flaps fully retracted, and 1.0 is flaps fully extended.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/controls/flap1_deploy_ratio

children.description: ACTUAL FLAP deployment for flap-set #2, in ratio, where 0.0 is flaps fully retracted, and 1.0 is flaps fully extended.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/controls/flap2_deploy_ratio

children.description: actual stabilizer deflection with trim for all-moving horizontal stabilizers. This is the deflection you can see visually on airliners. This is in degrees, positive for leading-edge nose up.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/controls/stabilizer_deflection_degrees

children.description: Aileron trim, in part of MAX FLIGHT CONTROL DEFLECTION. So, if the aileron trim is deflected enough to move the ailerons through 30% of their travel, then that is an aileron trim of 0.3.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/controls/aileron_trim

children.description: Elevator trim, in part of MAX FLIGHT CONTROL DEFLECTION. So, if the elevator trim is deflected enough to move the elevators through 30% of their travel, then that is an elevator trim of 0.3.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/controls/elevator_trim

children.description: Rudder trim, in part of MAX FLIGHT CONTROL DEFLECTION. So, if the rudder trim is deflected enough to move the rudders through 30% of their travel, then that is an rudder trim of 0.3.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/controls/rudder_trim

children.description: Rotor trim, in part of MAX FLIGHT CONTROL DEFLECTION. So, if the rotor trim is deflected enough to move the rotor through 30% of its travel, then that is a rotor trim of 0.3.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/controls/rotor_trim

children.description: Deployment of the water rudder, 0 is none, 1 is max
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/controls/water_rudder_deploy_ratio

children.description: Angle of deflection of the physical water rudders (for animating seaplane models))
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/controls/water_rudder_def_deg

children.description: Position of the tailhook handle in cockpit, 0 is stowed, 1 is deployed
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/controls/tailhook_handle
sim/flightmodel2/doors/
children.description: Landing gear doors.  These have been removed from X-Plane 12 (and were not available for newly authored v11 aircraft.)
0=unused (plane does not use this door) 1=standard (opens before gear goes down) 2=attached to strut (cycles with door), 3=closed (opens before gear goes down, then closes again)
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/doors/type

children.description: Gear door location, in meters, x, y z.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/doors/location_x_mtr

children.description: Gear door location, in meters, x, y z.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/doors/location_y_mtr

children.description: Gear door location, in meters, x, y z.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/doors/location_z_mtr

children.description: Axis of rotation of this gear door, degrees.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/doors/axis_rotation_deg

children.description: Current angle about the axis of rotation of this gear door, degrees.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/doors/angle_now_deg
sim/flightmodel2/engines/
children.description: Datarefs for the physical engines, props and rotors.
Engine location, meters x, y, z, with respect to the default center of gravity.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/location_x_mtr

children.description: Engine location, meters x, y, z, with respect to the default center of gravity.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/location_y_mtr

children.description: Engine location, meters x, y, z, with respect to the default center of gravity.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/location_z_mtr

children.description: Throttle that is actually going to the engine, which could be different than the commanded throttle due to FADEC throttle adjustments.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/throttle_used_ratio

children.description: Engine has fuel making to the mixture control, yes or no.  Writable if override_fuel_system is true.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/has_fuel_flow_before_mixture

children.description: Engine has fuel making to the combustion process, yes or no.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/has_fuel_flow_after_mixture

children.description: Engine is currently burning fuel, yes or no.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/engine_is_burning_fuel

children.description: How much fuel has been primed into the intake port (fuel-injected engine) 0..1
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/engine_fuel_in_intake

children.description: Engine running ratio, 0.0 for not running to 1.0 for fully running, combustion process fully started.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/engine_burning_fuel_ratio

children.description: Afterburner on, yes or no.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/afterburner_on

children.description: Afterburner engaged ratio, 0.0 to 1.0.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/afterburner_ratio

children.description: Rotational speed of the engine crank shaft, in radians per second.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/engine_rotation_speed_rad_sec

children.description: Angle of the engine crank shaft as it turns over, running 0 to 360 over and over again in normal operation. Engine speed can be different than prop rotation speed in clutched designs.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/engine_rotation_angle_deg

children.description: Radians per second rotation speed of the prop.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_rotation_speed_rad_sec

children.description: Angle of the prop or engine-fan as it rotates. You will see this value circulate 0 to 360 degrees over and over as the engine runs and the prop or fan turns.  If the prop looks like a blurry disc, this is how fast the blurry disc is 'spinning'.  Override with /prop_disc/override per engine!
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_rotation_angle_deg

children.description: Angle of the prop or engine-fan as it rotates. You will see this value circulate 0 to 360 degrees over and over as the engine runs and the prop or fan turns. This dataref NEVER shows the speed of the prop disc if it happens to be showing.  You can override this to modify rendering. Override witih /prop_disc/override per engine!
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_no_disc_rotation_angle_deg

children.description: ACTUAL pitch of the prop in degrees from its flat-pitch setting.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_pitch_deg

children.description: Coning angle of the disc, in radians. Typically close to 0.0.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_cone_angle_rad

children.description: Angle of the prop or engine-fan as it rotates.  This is the physical value for simulating the aircraft and is part of the engine flight modeling, and is not used to customize rendering. Writable in v12
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_angle_deg

children.description: This engine rotor-disc vertical vector, in degrees, where 0 is straight forwards, 90 is straight up.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/rotor_vertical_vector_deg

children.description: This engine rotor-disc longitudinal cyclic, in degrees, where -10 is 10 degrees forwards, 10 is 10 degrees aft.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/rotor_vertical_cyclic_deg

children.description: This engine rotor-disc lateral cyclic, in degrees, where -10 is 10 degrees left, 10 is 10 degrees right.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/rotor_side_cyclic_deg

children.description: This engine nacelle vertical vector, in degrees, where 0 is straight forwards, 90 is straight up.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/nacelle_vertical_angle_deg

children.description: How far the reverser doors/mechanism have traveled.  0 = fully stowed, 1.0 = fully deployed.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/thrust_reverser_deploy_ratio

children.description: Target N1 the fadec is limiting to
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/N1_FADEC

children.description: Target EPR the fadec is limiting to
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/EPR_FADEC

children.description: Is the prop a disc now?  Override with /prop_disc/override per engine!
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_is_disc

children.description: Degrees of deflection of a line from the crank shaft to the prop tip.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_tip_deflection_degrees

children.description: Is the electric fuel pump for this engine spinning?  1 = yes, 0 = no.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/fuel_pump_spinning

children.description: Is this starter running at all
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/starter_is_running

children.description: Is this starter applying torque to the engine
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/starter_making_torque

children.description: Engine fire, 0 means none, 1 means max.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/is_on_fire

children.description: Sign of the side of the ACF for this engine: -1 for left side, 0 for inline, 1 for right side
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/side_sign

children.description: N1 speed as percent of max (per engine)
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/N1_percent

children.description: N2 speed as percent of max (per engine)
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/N2_percent

children.description: ITT (per engine) in degrees C - use sim/flightmodel2/engines/actuators/ITT_deg_cel
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/ITT_deg_C

children.description: EGT (per engine) in degrees C - use sim/flightmodel2/engines/actuators/EGT_deg_cel
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/EGT_deg_C

children.description: CHT (per engine) in degrees C - use sim/flightmodel2/engines/actuators/CHT_deg_cel
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/CHT_deg_C

children.description: ITT (per engine) in degrees celcius
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/ITT_deg_cel

children.description: EGT (per engine) in degrees celcius
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/EGT_deg_cel

children.description: CHT (per engine) in degrees celcius
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/CHT_deg_cel

children.description: EGT (per engineper cylinder) in degrees celius. Up to 12 cylinders
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/EGT_CYL_cel

children.description: CHT (per engine per cylinder) in degrees celius
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/CHT_CYL_cel

children.description: Speed of jetwash behind the engine exhaust in meters/second
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/jetwash_mtr_sec

children.description: Speed of propwash behind the prop disc in meters/second
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/propwash_mtr_sec

children.description: Blade alpha is the dynamic-pressure-weighted average of all element angles of attack of the rotor blades. Expect blade slap as these numbers approach stall, if the disc angle of attack is near zero, so the vortices are not being cleared form the disc.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/rotor_blade_alpha_deg

children.description: Disc alpha is the anlge of attack of the rotor disc, after adding the influence of downwash through the disc. When this angle of attack is near zero, vortices from one blade will indeed interact with the next blade coming, since  air is not being cleared out of the disc in the vertical axis!
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/rotor_disc_alpha_deg

children.description: Disc slap is the audio slappping sound that happens when the blades of a rotor encounter the tip vortices of the blade in front of them. This happens when the rotor blades are at a high angle of attack, shedding large vortices, and the disc as at a low angle of attack, causing those vortices to not clear the disc vertically.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/rotor_blade_slap_rat

children.description: speed of exhaust velocity out of engine nozel relative to aircraft frame of reference
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/engn_exhaust_speed_msc

children.description: speed of exhaust velocity out of engine nozel relative to aircraft frame of reference
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/nozzle_speed_msc
sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_disc/
children.description: Datarefs for customizing prop disc visualization.
Set to 1 to control the prop disc from a plugin.  Overrides all other variables in this section.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_disc/override

children.description: If larger than zero, the prop disc is actually two discs, with this separation at the root and no separation at the tip.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_disc/disc_width

children.description: Ratio to scale the length of the side image.  1.0 = the real length of the prop.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_disc/disc_length_ratio

children.description: Offset from left (in 'slots') for the prop disc texture.  Fractions blend horizontal images.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_disc/disc_s

children.description: Offset from bottom (in 'slots') for the prop disc texture
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_disc/disc_t

children.description: Number of horizontal slots for the prop disc in the prop disc texture
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_disc/disc_s_dim

children.description: Number of vertical slots for the prop disc in the prop disc texture
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_disc/disc_t_dim

children.description: Alpha of prop disc when viewed from front.  X-Plane interpolates as the view angle moves.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_disc/disc_alpha_front

children.description: Alpha of prop disc when viewed of side.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_disc/disc_alpha_side

children.description: Ratio to multiply disc alpha when view is inside the airplane.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_disc/disc_alpha_inside

children.description: Width of prop side image in meters.  Height comes from prop radius.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_disc/side_width

children.description: Ratio to scale the length of the side image.  1.0 = the real length of the prop.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_disc/side_length_ratio

children.description: Rotation angle of the side images now - allows side to rotate independently of disc, perhaps faster.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_disc/side_angle

children.description: Number of side blades to draw.  Should be at least 2!
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_disc/side_number_of_blades

children.description: If true, prop side angle comes from billboarding logic - if false, it comes from side_angle dataref.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_disc/side_is_billboard

children.description: Offset from left (in 'slots') for the prop disc texture.  Fractions blend horizontal images.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_disc/side_s

children.description: Offset from bottom (in 'slots') for the prop disc texture
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_disc/side_t

children.description: Number of horizontal slots for the prop side in the prop disc texture
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_disc/side_s_dim

children.name: sim/flightmodel2/gear/
children.description: Datarefs for each landing of the gear.
Current gear heading angle, degrees. DEPRECATED - the angle for these was not computed correctly.  Use tire and strut deflection + deploy ratio.

children.description: Current gear roll angle, degrees. DEPRECATED - the angle for these was not computed correctly.  Use tire and strut deflection + deploy ratio.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/gear/gear_roll_deg

children.name: sim/flightmodel2/gear/tire_steer_command_deg

children.description: Steering command actually enacted by the gear, degrees positive right.  Writable in 1030.  Override via override_wheel_steer

children.description: Vertical deflection of this gear, meters.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/gear/tire_vertical_deflection_mtr

children.description: Vertical deflection of this gear, not including tire deformation, meters.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/gear/strut_vertical_deflection_mtr

children.description: Vertical force on this gear, newtons.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/gear/tire_vertical_force_n_mtr

children.description: Rotational speed of this tire, radians per second, absolute value never negative.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/gear/tire_rotation_speed_rad_sec

children.description: Rotational speed of this tire, radians per second, signed, goes negative when rolling backward.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/gear/tire_rotation_rate_rad_sec

children.description: Tire rotation in degrees, running 0 to 360 over and over as it rolls.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/gear/tire_rotation_angle_deg

children.description: Final total braking on this gear's tires, adding up all control inputs and sources.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/gear/tire_part_brake

children.description: Total absorbed energy in brake disc and pad on this tire. Heats up with braking, cools off as you fly.

children.name: sim/flightmodel2/wing/
children.description: Wing properties.  These give you the most specific access to control surfaces (for example, these include variable flaps with roll and pitch).  The wings are indexed as: wing 1 left, wing 1 right .. wing 4 left, wing 4 right, left hstab, right hstab, rudders 1 and 2, then the 20 misc wings, for 32 indices.
Deflection of the aileron from set #1 on this wing. Degrees, positive is trailing-edge down.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/wing/aileron1_deg

children.description: Deflection of the aileron from set #2 on this wing. Degrees, positive is trailing-edge down.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/wing/aileron2_deg

children.description: Deflection of the roll-spoilerfrom set #1 on this wing. Degrees, positive is trailing-edge down.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/wing/spoiler1_deg

children.description: Deflection of the roll-spoilerfrom set #1 on this wing. Degrees, positive is trailing-edge down.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/wing/spoiler2_deg

children.description: Deflection of the yaw-brake on this wing. A yaw-brake is a set of spoilers on the top and bottom of the wing that split open symmetrically to drag that wing aft and yaw the plane. They are used on the B-2, for example.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/wing/yawbrake_deg

children.description: Deflection of the elevator from set #1 on this wing. Degrees, positive is trailing-edge down.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/wing/elevator1_deg

children.description: Deflection of the elevator from set #2 on this wing. Degrees, positive is trailing-edge down.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/wing/elevator2_deg

children.description: Deflection of the rudder from set #1 on this wing. Degrees, positive is trailing-edge right.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/wing/rudder1_deg

children.description: Deflection of the rudder from set #2 on this wing. Degrees, positive is trailing-edge right.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/wing/rudder2_deg

children.description: Deflection of the flap from set #1 on this wing. Degrees, positive is trailing-edge down.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/wing/flap1_deg

children.description: Deflection of the flap from set #2 on this wing. Degrees, positive is trailing-edge down.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/wing/flap2_deg

children.description: Deflection of the speedbrakes from set #1 on this wing.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/wing/speedbrake1_deg

children.description: Deflection of the speedbrakes from set #2 on this wing.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/wing/speedbrake2_deg

children.description: The sweep increase BEYOND DEFAULT of this wing... this would only have a non-zero value for planes like the F-14 which can sweep their wings.
children.name: sim/flightmodel2/wing/airfoil_sweep_increase_deg
